cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 560 miles SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: continuing WNW today, then turning NW to NNW toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the upper Texas–southwest Louisiana border (around Sabine Pass/Cameron–Port Arthur area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch east of Intracoastal City to west of Morgan City, LA; Storm Surge Watch Freeport TX to San Luis Pass TX and from the Mouth of the Mississippi River to Ocean Springs MS, including the lakes
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning San Luis Pass TX to Intracoastal City LA; Storm Surge Warning San Luis Pass TX to the Mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts, including Sabine Lake and Calcasieu Lake
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds (≥74 mph) possible late Wednesday night through Thursday with gusts higher inland toward Beaumont
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 9–13 ft inundation in Sabine Lake area, including the Port Arthur/Beaumont waterway
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated 12 inches possible, causing flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Life-threatening surf and rip currents along the upper Texas coast; possible river flooding as rain drains inland
